common_issues.title: Pieces OS launch failure due to AVX2 requirement
common_issues.description: Users reported Pieces OS failing to launch on Windows and macOS after upgrading to version 11.1.1. The issue stemmed from stricter hardware requirements, specifically the need for AVX2 support. This affected users with older CPUs. The Pieces team addressed the issue by releasing version 11.1.2 with AVX2 adjustments, resolving the launch problem for most users.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User (GetReal444) reported an issue booting up the Pieces OS application.
* The issue appeared to be related to an AVX2 hardware requirement on the user's machine.
* This issue potentially affected other users as well.
* The Pieces team acknowledged the issue and proposed a solution.
* A fix was released in the 11.1.2 version of Pieces OS.

**Problems Identified:**

* User was unable to boot up the Pieces OS application.
* The issue was caused by an AVX2 hardware requirement not being met by the user's machine.
* This hardware requirement potentially affected other users as well.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team investigated the issue and determined the cause.
* A fix was developed and released in the 11.1.2 version of Pieces OS.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved with the release of the 11.1.2 version of Pieces OS.
* The user confirmed that the issue is fixed after updating to the latest version.

**Additional Notes:**

* The Pieces team was responsive and addressed the issue quickly.
* The team provided helpful resources and support to the user.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

- DevWizard24 reported an issue with PiecesOS not launching.
- GetReal444 confirmed the same problem.
- mark-at-pieces identified the issue as related to stricter hardware requirements in PiecesOS 11.1.1.
- tsavo-at-pieces confirmed the issue and mentioned a fix release coming soon.
- mark-at-pieces requested DevWizard24 to update to 11.1.2 and report the results.

**Problems Identified:**

- PiecesOS 11.1.1 had stricter hardware requirements than communicated, causing launch issues for some users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- Releasing a patch (11.1.2) to address the hardware requirement issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The patch (11.1.2) has been released.
- DevWizard24 is requested to update and report the results.

**Additional Notes:**

- The issue is related to GitHub issue #625.
- The Pieces support team provided helpful resources and communication throughout the process.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:**
* Pieces app was unable to launch on macOS and other systems due to AVX2 compatibility issues with the new vector library.

**Key Points Raised:**
* Issue automatically routed to Pieces team.
* User provided system information.
* Developer acknowledged the issue and shared potential solutions.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
* Released update v11.1.2 with AVX2 adjustments.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* Issue resolved as of February 15, 2025.
* User confirmed fix is working.

**Further Notes:**
* CPUs prior to 2016/2017 may still experience issues due to hardware limitations.
* User informed on Discord regarding the update.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Startup and Installation Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported various issues with PiecesOS, including slow startup times, installation failures, and the application not launching. These problems were often linked to specific macOS versions and Apple Silicon chips. Solutions included updating to the latest PiecesOS version, ensuring compatibility with the user's hardware, and contacting support for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces OS Unable to Run

**Key Points:**

* User reported unable to run Pieces OS on their M1 Mac.
* Pieces support team diagnosed the issue as users needing to install the correct build for their hardware (Apple Silicon vs. Intel).
* User confirmed they had installed the Apple Silicon build and Pieces for developers was now running correctly.

**Problems Identified:**

* User was using the wrong build for their hardware.
* User was running other Pieces processes that needed to be stopped.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support team suggested:
    * Checking Activity Monitor and stopping related processes.
    * Providing support logs.
    * Installing the correct build for their hardware.
* User confirmed they had installed the correct build and the issue was resolved.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue resolved.
* User confirmed Pieces for developers was running correctly.
* Support team closed the issue and referred user to ongoing announcement for further updates.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Issue Summary:

This GitHub issue concerns two separate problems experienced by users with PiecesOS:

**Problem 1 (Windows):**

* **Symptoms:** PiecesOS takes a long time to boot up and sometimes gets stuck.
* **Cause:** Identified as a major migration of data during the 11.1.0 update.
* **Resolution:**
    * Update to PiecesOS version 11.1.2.
    * If the issue persists, uninstall and reinstall PiecesOS.
    * If the issue persists after a reinstallation, provide detailed user logs to the PiecesOS support team.

**Problem 2 (Windows):**

* **Symptoms:** PiecesOS does not appear in the system tray and shows an error message stating it cannot start.
* **Cause:** Unknown, but possibly related to a conflict with OneDrive.
* **Resolution:**
    * Update to PiecesOS version 11.1.2.
    * If the issue persists, check if a "com.pieces.os" folder exists within the OneDrive/Documents location.
        * If the folder is empty, remove it.
        * If the folder is not empty, contact the PiecesOS support team.

## Key Points:

* Update to PiecesOS version 11.1.2 to address both problems.
* If the issue persists after updating, follow the specific troubleshooting steps for each problem.
* If further assistance is needed, contact the PiecesOS support team and provide detailed user logs.

## Additional Information:

* Additional details about the migration during the 11.1.0 update are not provided.
* It is unclear if the OneDrive conflict applies to both Windows and macOS versions of PiecesOS.
* The specific location of the "com.pieces.os" folder is not provided.
* The user logs referred to in the resolution steps are not further described.

## Current Status:

* As of February 14, 2025, both problems should be resolved for most users after updating to PiecesOS version 11.1.2.
* Users experiencing issues are encouraged to follow the troubleshooting steps and contact the PiecesOS support team for further assistance.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Startup Failure
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch or experiencing slow boot times after updates, particularly 11.1.0 and 11.1.1. This is potentially linked to data migration issues or conflicts with OneDrive. Solutions include updating to 11.1.2, reinstallation, or removing conflicting OneDrive folders.

related_issues.title: Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
related_issues.text:
Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I click on the title of Conversation in the Desktop app, I can edit it as expected but it will update save the input before I'm done editing.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Subject:** Renaming conversations doesn't work (Issue #1234)

**Key Points:**

* User @seantiz reported an issue where renaming conversations was not functioning correctly.
* @mack-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and stated that it would be investigated.
* A patch was released in v3.3.5 and v3.3.6 of the copilot & desktop app to address the issue.
* @seantiz confirmed that the issue was resolved after updating to the latest version.

**Problems Identified:**

* Renaming conversations was not working as intended.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A patch was released to fix the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved. 

## Additional Notes

* The original issue was reported on January 17, 2025.
* The issue was resolved on February 11, 2025. 
* The conversation highlights the importance of clear communication and timely updates between users and developers.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS High Resource Consumption
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM/CPU usage by PiecesOS, impacting system performance. This might be linked to internet connectivity, background processes, or specific features like LTM-1. Proposed solutions include restarting the application, disabling LTM-1, switching to cloud-only processing, and installing the latest updates which address memory leaks and optimize performance.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue 676: High RAM and CPU Usage

**Key points raised:**

* Users reporting high RAM and CPU usage with PiecesOS, sometimes exceeding 5GB and 100% respectively.
* This impacts system performance and slows down other applications.
* Some users suspect mining activities due to the high resource usage.

**Problems identified:**

* Memory leak in PiecesOS causing excessive RAM consumption.
* High CPU usage even when not actively using the application.
* Background processes within PiecesOS contributing to resource usage.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Replacing heavy database technologies in PiecesOS 11.1.0 to improve performance.
* "Optimize Memory" option to unload unused models and free up RAM.
* Turning off "Live Context" feature to reduce resource consumption.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Update to PiecesOS 11.1.0 released to address memory and CPU issues.
* Early reports from users indicate significant improvements in resource usage after the update.
* Further optimization efforts are ongoing.

**Additional Notes:**

* Some users still experience high CPU usage even after the update, suggesting further investigation is needed.
* Discussion regarding a "lite" mode with reduced resource usage for users who don't need all features.

related_issues.title: [Linux Mint 22.1] Pieces OS high CPU usage
related_issues.text:
[Linux Mint 22.1] Pieces OS high CPU usage
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS has high CPU usage even when idle and no LLM output is processing. Closing the desktop app or any other app with integrations like VScode makes no difference. The CPU usage sometimes drops down to 0% but immediately picks up back to 90%+. 
I dont have any local LLMs or any of the browser plugins installed. I am aware that similar issue was raised last year and was supposed to be fixed in 11.1.0, maybe it wasn't fixed entirely.


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3bedac0a-c9aa-48b9-a86a-6a3c4698d263
## Summary of Pieces Application Support Conversation

**Issue Reported:** High resource consumption by Pieces application (RAM and CPU usage).

**Key points raised:**

- User experiencing slow response and performance issues with Pieces.
- Identified as potential issue with the LTM-1 feature responsible for long-term memory.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

- Turn off LTM-1 for optimal performance.
- Change Machine Learning enrichment mode to "cloud-only" to reduce local processing.

**Current status/outcome:**

- User confirmed that switching off LTM solved the performance issue.
- User will revisit using LTM with higher local computing power.

**Additional Information:**
 
- Related existing Issues mentioned in the conversation may provide further context or troubleshooting options for similar problems.
- Documentation, FAQ and YouTube Channel links were shared for reference and additional resources.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

- DevWizard24 reported an issue with PiecesOS not launching.
- GetReal444 confirmed the same problem.
- mark-at-pieces identified the issue as related to stricter hardware requirements in PiecesOS 11.1.1.
- tsavo-at-pieces confirmed the issue and mentioned a fix release coming soon.
- mark-at-pieces requested DevWizard24 to update to 11.1.2 and report the results.

**Problems Identified:**

- PiecesOS 11.1.1 had stricter hardware requirements than communicated, causing launch issues for some users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- Releasing a patch (11.1.2) to address the hardware requirement issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The patch (11.1.2) has been released.
- DevWizard24 is requested to update and report the results.

**Additional Notes:**

- The issue is related to GitHub issue #625.
- The Pieces support team provided helpful resources and communication throughout the process.

recommendations: **Address PiecesOS Startup Issues:** Prioritize resolving issues related to PiecesOS startup failures and slow boot times, especially those linked to specific macOS versions, Apple Silicon chips, and recent updates (11.1.0 and 11.1.1).  This could involve investigating data migration processes and potential conflicts with OneDrive.

**Improve AVX2 Compatibility Communication:** Clearly communicate AVX2 hardware requirements for PiecesOS to prevent launch failures for users with older CPUs.  This could involve pre-installation checks or more prominent documentation.

**Optimize PiecesOS Resource Consumption:** Address concerns about high RAM and CPU usage by PiecesOS. Investigate potential memory leaks, optimize background processes, and explore options for users to manage resource consumption, such as disabling specific features or switching to cloud-only processing.

**Gather More Information on Intermittent Issues:** For issues like slow startup times and high resource usage that are often linked to internet connectivity or specific user configurations, gather more detailed user logs and system information to help pinpoint the root cause and develop targeted solutions.

**Review and Update Support Documentation:** Ensure support documentation, FAQs, and troubleshooting guides are up-to-date with information on common issues, including those related to AVX2 compatibility, startup problems, and high resource usage. Provide clear instructions and workarounds for users experiencing these problems.

**Consider a PiecesOS Lite Mode:** Explore the feasibility of a "lite" mode for PiecesOS that offers reduced functionality with lower resource consumption. This could cater to users with less powerful hardware or those who only require basic features.
